I recently bought the book.  Very easy reading and it
made a heck of a lot more sense than the docs off the
Junit.org site.  I will be recommending it to the
other developers in my group as we try to embrace more
of the XP philosophies in our development.

Curt
--- Johannes Link <john.link@...> wrote:
> 
>  > I am looking for a book like "introduction to
> unit testing" any
> > recommedations ? I have just read "Extreme
> Programming Explained" by
> > Kent Beck which was an inspiring read and have
> used junit and jfunc a
> > bit but need more guidance - if you know what I
> mean.
> 
> IMO the book mentioned in the subject line ("Unit
> Testing in Java") is a
> good choice for you then. But I'm prejudiced, I'm
> the author.
> 
> Johannes
>
